description: After briefly ceding to Sabrina Carpenter, “I Had Some Help" is back on top of the Billboard Hot 100 songs chart. Taylor Swift’s The Tortured Poets Department is still No. 1 over on the Billboard 200 albums chart — she’s holding strong at ten weeks.
title: Post Malone recaptures the No. 1 song spot with 'I Had Some Help'

description: Comedy writer Ian Karmel has been making fun of his own body since he was a kid. He wrote T-Shirt Swim Club: Stories from Being Fat in a World of Thin People along with his sister.
title: A member of the 'T-Shirt Swim Club' chronicles life as 'the funny fat kid'

description: Medical amputation isn't a uniquely human form of medicine, it turns out. Some ant species will cut off the limbs of injured buddies when it's necessary to save them.
title: Ants treat certain leg injuries with life-saving amputations

description: A Louisiana law requires classrooms to post the 10 Commandments, but Jews and Christians don't necessarily agree on what they are. Even among Christians, views vary on what Commandments are for.
title: Louisiana mandate stirs debate about the 10 Commandments and their purpose

description: In 1984, on the cusp of superstardom, Bruce Springsteen agreed to let a producer rework three songs from his upcoming album, Born in the U.S.A. 40 years later, those remixes have nearly vanished.
title: The nearly forgotten story of the 'Born in the U.S.A.' remixes
